stream_context.summary: Kaze prototypes a new ‘soap bar’ rideable object (based on Koopa-shell code) and an accompanying bubble trail, then begins planning an oil-puddle obstacle the soap will clean.  He also evaluates Biobak’s concept for a new star-select screen and debates memory-saving 3D panoramas versus large 2D images.

development_findings.summary: The overworld is an island whose water level may gradually rise, re-using Wet/Dry World style manipulation.
development_findings.quote: The overworld is an island that you rescue, so it makes sense if water returned over time.

development_findings.summary: Each course will get a new star-select screen featuring a tiny 3D panorama rather than a full 320×240 texture to save ~0.3-0.5 MB per level.
development_findings.quote: Pre-rendered 3D is cheaper ROM-wise and will look better than a blurry low-res JPEG.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s ‘simple drawing’ mock-ups are guiding the final star-select layout; Kaze is unhappy with his own prototype and will iterate on Biobak’s version.
Kaze implemented a rideable soap bar by re-using the built-in ‘Ridden OBJ’ pointer used for Koopa shells, a capability he hadn’t noticed before.
development_findings.quote: There’s a whole interaction type for this? How did I not know that? Alright, I guess we use this.

development_findings.summary: Soap bar behaviour: player can ride briefly, soap shrinks over time, drops Mario if speed threshold exceeded, then despawns.
Created a custom bubble particle effect: IA-16 texture, alpha fade, hue shift, spawned via Kaze’s own engine (avoids texture reloads).
Planned mechanic: oil puddles that look reflective / rainbow and are erased (alpha cleared) when Mario rides the soap over them, effectively cleaning the level.
development_findings.quote: Oil slick: Mario goes through with soap, delete the alpha on all pixels he’s touched.

development_findings.summary: Experimented with vertex-color hue-shifts tied to camera angle to fake oil sheen; normal-mapped reflections deemed too expensive.
Performance tweak noted: orange fog severely hurts FPS; may be removed before release.
Fast64 exporter is primary level-building workflow; Kaze prefers N64 target over PC port because PC branch is harder to maintain.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses frustration with frequent Parallel Launcher updates and prefers Project64 1.6 for testing.
context_findings.quote: If I open Parallel Launcher right now and there’s an update I’m gonna be pissed. It’s been a week—there are three!

context_findings.summary: He received an unexpected rape threat online and shares mild shock but shrugs it off humorously.
context_findings.quote: As a male I’ve gotten a rape threat—that’s insane. Death threats happen, but this is new.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dismisses academic philosophy as ‘stupid,’ sparking a comedic rant with chat.
context_findings.quote: Maybe I said I think philosophy is stupid. Philosophy people lose it when you do that.

context_findings.summary: Mentions Zeina is at work while he streams, joking he’s ‘held hostage,’ hinting at casual home-work balance.
Ends stream due to hunger, highlighting long, focused dev sessions without breaks.

biobak.summary: Provided a well-received mock-up for the new star-select screen, steering the UI direction.
biobak.quote: Biobak had this here, which I think works a lot better already.

biobak.summary: Gave real-time feedback on visual polish (bubble transparency, oil color, bubble quantity).

key_stories.title: Discovering the Ridden-Object Pointer
key_stories.summary: While trying to script the soap bar, Kaze stumbles upon an existing interaction type meant for Koopa shells.  Reusing it instantly solves follow-logic issues.
key_stories.challenge: Soap bar wasn’t following Mario correctly and manual code was failing.
key_stories.process: Browsed decomp, noticed ‘Ridden OBJ’, tested it in engine.
key_stories.outcome: Soap now inherits shell riding behaviour, saving time and bugs.
key_stories.key_quote: There’s a whole interaction type for this? How did I not know that?

key_stories.title: Star-Select Memory Crunch
key_stories.summary: Large 2D backdrops for every level would blow up ROM size, so the team debates alternatives.
key_stories.challenge: A 320×240 texture per course costs ~0.5 MB, unsustainable for cartridge limits.
key_stories.process: Compare Biobak’s mock-ups, test anti-aliased drawings, discuss compression and pre-rendered 3D.
key_stories.outcome: Decision to pursue miniature 3D panoramas to keep memory low and emulator output sharp.
key_stories.key_quote: Pre-render a higher draw-distance background? That’s worse than having the 3D model.

key_stories.title: Building the Bubble Trail
key_stories.summary: To visualize soap movement, Kaze crafts a custom particle with color-fade and efficient texture handling.
key_stories.challenge: Original Mario64 particle system re-loads textures per sprite, killing performance.
key_stories.process: Uses own engine, modifies IA-16 bubble texture, tunes alpha and spawn rate based on chat feedback.
key_stories.outcome: Smooth bubble trail that costs little VRAM and sets visual tone for cleanliness mechanic.
key_stories.key_quote: Good thing we have a good particle engine—otherwise this would be awful.
